bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Richard Frayser (1830-1899) was a captain in the Confederate army, originally from New Kent County, Virginia. Following the Civil War he worked as a businessman and lawyer in Appomattox County and Richmond.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of correspondence and assorted clippings and copies of articles, prayers, and addresses collected by Frayser. Most correspondence relates to business and legal matters; one letter conveys Frayser's opposition to Virginia's secession and his plea for the preservation of the Union. Also includes printed advertisements from the Blue Ridge Academy and the Washington Academy.
